metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8704 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
apl_42.c in ISC BIND 9.x before 9.9.8-P3, 9.9.x, and 9.10.x before 9.10.3-P3 allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (INSIST assertion failure and daemon exit) via a malformed Address Prefix List (APL) record.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8704` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.7
bind9-host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.7
bind9utils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.7
dnsutils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.7
host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.7
libbind9-90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.7
libdns100 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.7
libisc95 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.7
libisccc90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.7
libisccfg90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.7
liblwres90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.7
lwresd - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.7
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> these missed OTA9 in vivid/stable-phone-overlay and should be included in OTA9.5 via https://launchpad.net/~ci-train-ppa-service/+archive/ubuntu/stable-snapshot/+packages landed in rc-proposed in r385 on krillin: http://people.canonical.com/~lzemczak/landing-team/ubuntu-touch/rc-proposed/ubuntu/krillin/385.commitlog

criterions.comment: bind9 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.7').
